text:
Anyone have time to do a quick SANITY CHECK for me?   I'm not sure if this is a recent HubSpot Bug (NO BUG AFTER ALL. See thread.) related to the AUTO SAVE feature in the CMS but here is what's going on.

<https://www.loom.com/share/8d9132706e0b4c3487634f729db711df>

link to preview page:
<https://companyon-9411827.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-8bad7194-ef23-4d1f-b032-7ecb84300bf6?hs_preview=EIpniYNT-57353513848>
your event listeners are bound properly, but the click event isnâ€™t firing when the click actually happens. If you trigger the click with jquery it works fine.

I suspect there is some weirdness going on related to you right click + inspecting, that div higher up that the dev tools opened up to is what the browser thought should receive the click. Are you you messing with zindexes / weird positioning?
your `z-index` on the `.hhs-img-text-mod` class is causing the image and link to not work, changing that to a zero seems to do the trick.
can you change the module settings back to file and I can retest it real quick to see if it works for that also (i tested for the popup which is what it is set to now)
alternatively, you can probably also just remove the `z-index: -1` on the `.hhs-img-text-mod` as well.
Thanks so much for the sanity check <@UA886MF42> and <@U2H3TT8F2>.  I just changed it back to file but will play with the z-index on my end.
<@U2H3TT8F2> you were right. The negative z-index did the trick.  The super odd this is that this worked yesterday with the negative z-index.  At any rate... Thanks so much.
yep it works on file as well. its a `z-index` issue, not a bug.
posted to main channel as well so folks skimming are aware there is no bug :slightly_smiling_face:
You rock! My hair was turning even more gray by the millisecond.
totally understandable. When you add `z-index` into the mix of things, things can get out of whack fast.
